main event: On 16 January 1952, two members of a balloon project and four civilians observed two unidentified aerial objects over Artesia, New Mexico.
interesting points: The objects were described as spherical or circular in shape and were observed at altitudes of 30,000 ft. and 20,000 ft.,The objects were seen twice: once from Artesia and once from the nearby airport,The witnesses reported that the objects circled the balloon and flew off to the northwest,Obserers included reliable and experienced witnesses,The sighting lasted for about 60 seconds during the balloon observation.
witness description: two members of a balloon project and four civilian pilots
